data.name: Zero Losses
data.detailed_description:

About the Game

Zero Losses is a short open-world driving adventure game with horror elements and a hollow atmosphere in the set inspired by the events of the Russo-Ukrainian War.

You play as a contract serviceman of a support battalion, not participating in the events on the frontline, but working in a chain of supplies behind it. While your other comrades defend The Motherland by expanding its borders, you follow them, arriving at the liberated scorched earth. For long days at the wheel of a truck, you drive through the deserted streets of dead cities and villages, diligently avoiding explosion craters while the empty orbits of broken windows are watching you.

You are not involved in the violent flames of war, but you are the one who fuels it. Sometimes you carry the ammunition or fuel, sometimes you deal with medical or humanitarian aid. The war requires much more effort other than shooting. As part of the occupying troops, your goal is to also ensure the minimization of irretrievable losses, including preventing the loss of property and finding missing units.

Unlike most war-related games Zero Losses is not an action game: it’s a slow-paced surreal road trip through the apocalypse. The game does not showcase the violence but introduces you to the aftermath of it.

data.short_description: Survive the modern warfare horror as a soldier of a support battalion, driving your truck through the war-ravaged lands behind the frontline. While others carry the banner of victory forward, your task is not to shoot, but to ensure that this "special operation" has zero losses.
